meanings.definition: Forces that push an object downward.
meanings.sent1: The downforces of gravity keep us on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The airplane's wings create downforces to help it stay in the air.
meanings.sent3: The downforces of the heavy rain made the umbrella flip inside out.
meanings.sent4: The downforces of the team's determination propelled them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The downforces of the magnet pulled the metal object towards it.

meanings.definition: The downward pressure exerted on an object.
meanings.sent1: The downforces of the heavy book made the shelf bow.
meanings.sent2: The downforces of the water crushed the empty bottle.
meanings.sent3: The downforces of the crowd made it hard to move through the concert hall.
meanings.sent4: The downforces of the mountain pressed down on the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The downforces of the hammer cracked the fragile glass.

meanings.definition: To apply pressure or weight in a downward direction.
meanings.sent1: She downforces the stamp onto the envelope to mail the letter.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers downforces the beam into place with precision.
meanings.sent3: He downforces the lid onto the jar to keep the cookies fresh.
meanings.sent4: The chef downforces the knife to slice the vegetables evenly.
meanings.sent5: The athlete downforces the barbell to build strength in their muscles.
